page.title: 09TRETOIL FARM 1
page.content: Tretoil farm is farmed by Mr. Kendall and owned by the Lanhydrock Estate. The total area of holding is 150 acres - 135 acres of grassland and 15 acres of roughland, including overgrown spoil mounds from the disused tin mines. Farm animals include:- 50 cattle, mostly South Devon, 70 ewes, Devon and Cornwall longwool, 6 horses. Sheep produce 7 kilograms of wool, Rams 12-18 kilograms and lambs 2\ kilograms. All cows keep thier calves. There is no milking. Tretoil grows all its own grass for hay. Corn and straw is brought in. The farmer Mr. Kendall, is now in his seventies and enjoys his farm in the old fashion way. One hasa the impression that it has not changed in about 100 years.
